JobFullDesc: About the Role:  The Senior Strategy and Planning Associate will join the Uber Eats S&P team. This team fulfills a key business partner function within the organisation, working to distil business insights to shape an informed strategy, champion effective growth investments and enable organisational effectiveness. Leveraging business acumen and analytical experience gained from challenging environments in the past, this role will be instrumental in driving our business forward. We’re looking for someone who can zoom out to set a vision and solve problems from 30,000 feet, as well as zoom in to dive deep into the details.  As a partner to our Uber Operations and Cross Functional teams, you will help support the strategic decision making process throughout the Japan region by utilizing your  analytical skills, a heavy data driven approach and an operational mindset. The ideal candidate for this role has strong analytical skills, excellent time-management and organisational habits, experience navigating and influencing a cross-functional, matrixed organisation, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information to senior stakeholders. What you will do: Work closely with operations, marketing, sales, finance and team members within S&P to identify important trends, problems and opportunities Set governance processes, manage rhythm and cadence of operations for the entire businessDrive analysis on important strategic decisions to propel the business forwardSet strategic priorities, translate them into concrete projects & work closely with teams across the region to deliver on executionDistil large volumes of information and present them back to the business in the form of succinct business insightsEvaluate the economic and strategic costs/benefits of programs and work with management to execute those strategies Develop strategic and analytical frameworks to support the company in new markets and productsWork closely in a matrixed environment with operations, marketing, analytics, product, finance in the region and at HQ to set clear objectives for the businessWork closely with other members of the Uber team to measure the impact and efficiency of new products and business processesIdentify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes to keep our local teams as efficient as possibleBuild, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting models to assist city-level, regional, and expansion efforts as well as ensuring a tight cadence on financial reporting and delivery as part of our overall commitment to the APAC region as a businessBe a resourceful multi-tasker, supporting teams across the region. You'll be the go-to person for many key organisational initiatives requiring cross functional collaborationLeverage the professional development and learning opportunities from frequent direct engagement with senior leadership across the Eats business
